fields.description:
In addition to access keys and URLs, credential zip files contain three types of X.509... things.  To finish making credential zip files unnecessary we must make these unnecessary or make them easy to obtain.

h4. User private keys
Private keys are easy to create using euare-useraddcert, but since EUCA-10838 the compute service no longer checks bundle signatures, so we will instead make private keys, and thus signatures, optional.

If a signature element is missing EC2 throws 400s.  If a signature element is present, but empty, EC2 throws 500s.  If a signature element is present and has invalid contents, EC2 accepts the manifest.  An unsigned bundle will therefore include a fake {{UNSIGNED}} signature.

h4. User certificates
User certificates are what allow users to later unbundle images, given matching private keys.  Unbundling images is somewhat uncommon, so we will allow bundling to proceed without a user certificate at the cost of users not being able to unbundle them.

If the elements related to this ({{user_encrypted_key}}, {{user_encrypted_iv}}) are missing EC2 throws 400s.  If they are present, but empty, EC2 accepts the manifest.  A bundle with no corresponding user key will therefore contain those empty elements.

It is worth noting that the manifests generated by BundleInstance tasks in EC2 lack these elements entirely.  Those manifests follow a different and incompatible specification, so to keep complexity under control euca2ools will not attempt to implement them.

h4. Cloud certificates
The cloud's certificate is mandatory because it is a prerequisite for the cloud's ability to use a bundled image.  EUCA-10784 added a web service call that eliminates the need for a side channel for obtaining this certificate.

When a cloud certificate is not supplied to a euca2ools bundling command via any of the existing means the command will attempt to access the empyrean service to obtain the certificate automatically.  If this fails for any reason, such as missing credentials or a missing URL, the command will fail as before, with a modified error message:

{quote}euca-bundle-image: error: missing cloud certificate; please supply one with --ec2cert or use --empyrean-url to fetch one automatically{quote}

Users under IAM policy control require the {{euserv:DescribeServiceCertificates}} capability to use this functionality.
fields.summary: Make certificate and private key options to bundle commands optional

comments.body: I suspect this is not particularly important, but since it involves signatures a cursory security review couldn't hurt.
I spoke with Vika about this in person.
